<OLD>


> LORD ELDER looked over at WHEELIE with knowing optics. ELDER knew=
 that
> he was old, older than probrably some of these Maximals suspected, =
but
> he could feel a great age in WHEELIE, an age that was getting tired.
=
> 
> "There's got to be somehting more to this then simple survival, of
> j=
ust living." ELDER sighed, "I mean if that's all there is then what
> are w=
e figting for, what are we living for?"
> 
> He looked back at the skies ag=
ain, the stars twinkling in the velvet
> of the night skies. "What do you w=
ant out of life? What would you be
> if there was no war?"
> 

<NEW>

The i=
rony was probably deep, and unkonwn to most, but Wheelie was old by the sta=
ndards of most Autobots, having come online before the onset of the war ins=
tigated by Megatron, and yet was one of the most childish and ill behaved o=
f any who had worn any banner.  

Wheelie shrugged, "What else is there but=
 to stay alive?  It's not like it gets any better after this dive.  What is=
 there to look forward for?  A never ending life of war?  And should we att=
empt to move on, to the AllSpark we shall be gone.  And it will bring us ba=
ck someday, to fight the war in another way.  A lifespan that compares to t=
he stars, yet locked in hatred like old fashioned cars.  All I know, all I =
say, is that the war will not end any day.  All it will be is waiting for t=
he next battle to come out in forray."

For the last bit, the last question=
, Wheelie looked up at the LORD ELDER a little sadly, "What I want out of l=
ife?  What I want is an end tos trife.  For it is all I have ever known.  T=
error and war all over my home.  I know it shall not end while I am around,=
 and when I am but another shell interred within the ground.  It was the pa=
st, it shall be what is to be.  Even when we are but history."
